Tasks.Task: Download and configure the sample project
Tasks.Task Description: Clone the sample project from the GitHub repository and navigate to the JavaScript-v4 subdirectory to open the project in your code editor.

Tasks.Task: Accept uploaded file as a blob parameter
Tasks.Task Description: Configure the Azure Function to accept the uploaded file as a blob parameter.

Tasks.Task Description: Implement the code to analyze the uploaded blob using the Computer Vision service.

Tasks.Task: Insert analyzed image text into Cosmos DB
Tasks.Task Description: Use output bindings to insert the analyzed image text, as a JSON object, into Cosmos DB.

Tasks.Task Description: Install the necessary packages for Azure Blob Storage and Azure Identity client libraries using pip.

Tasks.Task Description: Add import statements for DefaultAzureCredential, BlobServiceClient, BlobClient, and ContainerClient in your Python code file.

Tasks.Task Description: Update the project to use the Azure Blob Storage connection string using the func settings add command.

Use Visual Studio Code to run the function locally and test the storage blob input binding.

Tasks.Task: Deploy the function using Visual Studio
Tasks.Task Description: Use Visual Studio to deploy your function to Azure and ensure it is connected to the Storage Blob.

Declare the Azure storage and the newly created container in the Miria Web UI and configure it as a source for future workflows.

Tasks.Task: Plan and manage costs for Azure Blob Storage
Tasks.Task Description: Use the Azure pricing calculator to estimate costs, optimize the storage account, and set budgets to monitor costs.
